alert.note: Alert for Brown (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 9:45PM CDT until May 20 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Cottonwood River Above Springfield affecting Brown County. Minnesota River at New Ulm affecting Brown, Blue Earth and Nicollet Counties. Minnesota River at Mankato affecting Blue Earth and Nicollet Counties. Minnesota River at Savage affecting Carver, Scott, Hennepin and Dakota Counties. Redwood River near Redwood Falls affecting Redwood County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Minnesota River at Morton affecting Redwood and Renville Counties. Minnesota River at Montevideo affecting Lac qui Parle, Chippewa and Yellow Medicine Counties. Cannon River at Northfield affecting Rice and Dakota Counties. Cottonwood River at New Ulm affecting Brown County. Minnesota River at Henderson MN19 affecting Le Sueur, Sibley and Scott Counties. Minnesota River near Jordan affecting Carver, Sibley and Scott Counties. .Heavy rainfall across southern Minnesota this weekend has caused significant rises in area rivers. River levels should crest within the next few days and then slowly fall as a dry weather pattern prevails. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cottonwood River at New Ulm. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Flood waters reach the back of the campground at Flandrau SP * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 900 PM CDT Sunday, the stage was 15.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 900 PM CDT Sunday was 15.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.1 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Friday evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.2 feet on 03/24/2011. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
